How do I export a wallet using the `z_exportwallet` command?

To export a wallet, you need to issue the following command: `z_exportwallet FILENAME` (e.g., `z_exportwallet export_instance01`). The filename cannot have a `.` in it. This command will generate a file that you can then copy to the machine that hosts your main wallet.

# Question: How to consolidate multiple `wallet.dat` files in one? Attention: Read it completely before using. ### Verus `Wallet.dat`, Chaindata & `VRSC.conf` standard locations * Linux:		`~/.komodo/VRSC` * Mac OS: 	`~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC` * Windows 10: 	`%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\` * OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)` ## Procedure 1. With one of the wallets loaded, issue the following command: `z_exportwallet FILENAME` (ie z_exportwallet export_instance01, the filename cannot have a `.` in it.) 2. Copy the generated file to the machine that hosts your main wallet. This file will either be in the same directory as the config file and wallet.dat file, or in a location specified by exportdir in VRSC.conf. 3. Issue the following command (on the "main" verus-cli): `z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/EXPORTFILENAME` (ie /home/user/export_instance01) note: Older versions of verusd required `expordir` to be set in VRSC.conf before exporting a wallet. If you get an error about your export directory not being set, please upgrade immediately. #### These commands can be given in: * CLI wallet: `./verus z_exportwallet FILENAME`& `./verus z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME` * Verus Desktop in `settings`, `coin settings`: `run z_exportwallet FILENAME`& `run z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME` * Verus Agama in `settings`, `<CLI>`: `z_exportwallet FILENAME`& `z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME` (submitted by @TexWiller, revised by @englal) note: last revision date 2020-09-30.
./raw_txt_input/faq-allos04_consolidate_multiple_wallet.dat_files_in_one.md
What are the standard locations for Verus `wallet.dat`, Chaindata, and `VRSC.conf` files on different operating systems?

The standard locations for Verus `wallet.dat`, Chaindata, and `VRSC.conf` files are:
* Linux: `~/.komodo/VRSC`
* Mac OS: `~/Library/Application Support/Komodo/VRSC`
* Windows 10: `%AppData%\Roaming\Komodo\VRSC\`
* OS independent through Verus Desktop: Click `help`, `Show Verus data folder (default)`

Can I use these commands in different interfaces?

Yes, you can use these commands in different interfaces:
* CLI wallet: `./verus z_exportwallet FILENAME` and `./verus z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME`
* Verus Desktop: In `settings`, `coin settings`, use `run z_exportwallet FILENAME` and `run z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME`
* Verus Agama: In `settings`, `<CLI>`, use `z_exportwallet FILENAME` and `z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/FILENAME`

How do I import a wallet using the `z_importwallet` command?

To import a wallet, you need to issue the following command: `z_importwallet /LOCAL_PATH/EXPORTFILENAME` (e.g., `/home/user/export_instance01`). This command will import the exported wallet file into your main wallet.

Where will the exported wallet file be located?
The exported wallet file will be located in the same directory as the config file and wallet.dat file, or in a location specified by `exportdir` in `VRSC.conf`.
